Yelp API

curl --location 'https://x0n1-tbv3-v8eo.n7.xano.io/api:ag2Iad7F/reviews_by_formId?form_id=25'

Form id param is where we mention the restaurant number as shown

API response contains both reviews, photos to be used

The entire staff was incredible and it's clear that teamwork is a value here. \n\nWe were one of several large groups on a Wednesday night and we still had an incredible experience. \n\nFortunately, because I was part of a group, I got to try a number of the dishes! The fritto misto is light and tasty. The arancini was light and creamy, but a little salty for my taste. (I would still order it again!) The herbed potatoes were crispy and perfect. The broccoli rabe made me feel good about including veggies, but was a little salty for my taste. The homemade focaccia was amazing! I could seriously just eat only that every day and be happy. The standouts for me are the Margherita pizza, which was one of the best I've ever had; and the Agnolotti which was just perfection! Try to save room for dessert, if you can! The cheesecake and tiramisu were good, but the flourless chocolate cake was the perfect way to end the meal. \n\nI will definitely be back on future trips to NYC!",

                                    "text": {
                                        "full": "We attended a baby shower at this venue and had a great time. \n\nThe place is super cool. Small but can accommodate the invited guests appropriately.  The ambiance is just perfect for the event! \n\nWe were served the simplest appetizers for  the cocktail hour but surprisingly filling. The cocktails are good. Glad that we do not have to go to the bar as  the service was quick.  \n\nOn our Buffett meal, the hosts  choices are perfectly picked.                                             "text": {
                                                "full": "Gran Morsi has been open for Years! And I have been coming for years, from celebrating birthdays and having casual dinners. This spot is one of the best in all of downtown/Fidi area. I have to caveat that haven't been back since pre-pandemic, and am happy to see that it is still thriving. \n\nWe went with a huge group to celebrate a birthday, ordered a la carte (which looking back at it, not sure if it was a good idea, they offered an $85 per person family style dinner menu). Next time I would opt to do this choice. Nonetheless, we ordered multiple dishes of apps and entrees. \n\nSome of the highlights to the apps were the crispy calamari and arancini, also got the octopus (Polpo), which was very interesting, it was not a typical polpo dish you'd expect, it had stuffing. \n\nFor entree, ordered the Veal Milanese, which was huge and should be shared. I had a piece that was still very pink inside, I am not convinced it should be like this. \n\nMy favorite was the broccoli rabe side dish, was very tender and delicious!   \n\nOverall, a few misses, but decent food and great crowd.",

Definitely worth a try.\n\nTaste: 5/5\nService: 4/5\nAmbiance: 4/5\nValue for money: 2.5/5\n\nWe had:\n\n1) Polpette: the must get!                                     "text": {
                                        "full": "My fianc and I walk a lot when we visit New York City. We decided to treat ourselves to some OTC carb loading with Italian food. I found Gran Morsi on Yelp and was excited by all the photos. We arrived later in the evening and thankfully it wasn't too busy to seat us immediately. This restaurant is very charming. The service is extremely kind. The ambiance is very romantic. I love the dim lighting and plant walls.\n\nOur server kindly went over the different menus. They were a part of a special food week and had a $60 three course option. Unfortunately, we weren't hungry enough to each get that. However, we did end up getting some really yummy dishes. I got the linguine cacio e pepe. The sauce was divine. I haven't have a cacio e pepe that good in a while. I finished every last bite and tried my best not to lick the plate. My fianc got the carbone pizza. Our server warned him it was spicy. It definitely was, but it was delicious. The honey drizzle really complimented the dish. We had a great time at this restaurant. I'd recommend stopping here for Italian food.",

                                    "text": {
                                        "full": "I came here with two of my friends who also have never been here. We wanted to go somewhere for NYC restaurant week so I found this place and sure glad I did and that we all agreed upon this place. \n\nMy friends ordered old fashions which on the menu are called Vecchio Stile which is four roses bourbon, angelis orange liqueur, bitters and smoked cedar as their first drink and then one of them ordered a spicy marg which had milagro tequila, amaretto, orange and calabrian chilies and he liked both of the drinks. I had a Tre Fiore:\nempress 1908 gin, prosecco, elderflower, chamomile, lavender, honey, lemon. The service on our drinks were a bit on the slow side. \n\nFor food we ordered a margherita pizza to share and my friend and I had the butternut squash soup which had parmigiano-reggiano, sage and pistachio, it was delightful. And other friend had the crudo which was yellowfin tuna, wild salmon, and calabarian chilies and it was crisp. As our mains I had chicken parmigiana that came with chitarra pomodoro. They were all Great portion size and tasty. My other friend had the New York Strip steak which is 14oz, black pepper crusted dish. As a dessert I and my other friend had the Bombolini sundae which was Italian doughnut balls with vanilla gelato and hot chocolate on top.  My other friend had the Tiramisu. We also were celebrating a birthday so they brought out a sparkler and also a round of limoncello shots but in non shot glasses. More of an after\ndinner drink type glasses. Which was very nice of them.\n\n\nStaff were very friendly, took my food allergies into consideration. The atmosphere was\nchic, though a bit on the noisy side. We had a\ngreat table though for the three of us. It was a round booth in the corner which was\nactually right in front of the Morsi sign so made for a great group picture. I am telling all my family and friends about this place. If you find yourself in the area its a must try place!",

                                    "text": {
                                        "full": "Decided to come here for restaurant week. What drew me to them was their meatballs that they proudly boast beat Bobby Flay. \n\nThe meatballs were flavored well but a little dense. They were good but didn't quite wow me. The tomato sauce was super fresh and delish. \n\nthe crudo was a bit too 'fresh' for us so we sent that back. \n\nThe kale salad was sooo good. I really enjoyed the dressing. \n\nThe shoestring fries were tasty but they didn't really go with the meal. \n\nThe star of the show was the Branzino. The sauce was DIVINE and cooked to perfection. Wow so good. \n\nThe panettone dessert was overrated. They light the dessert on fire I guess for performance but to me it ended up burning the caramel. So the sauce tasted charred and the bread pudding was sooo soggy inside. Overall not a fan but the portion size was huge and good for sharing. \n\nThe pear tart wasn't tart at all. I was hoping for something light but it was overall just bland. \n\nThe Italian doughnuts were too dense but the gelato was good. \n\nThe drinks were tasty but a little pricey. \n\nCustomer service was VERY good. Shoutout to Anna. She was really great. \n\nOverall, it was a very hit or miss experience but I'd be willing to try them again. It was a little more expensive than I anticipated so we were kind of bummed that we didn't love it.",

Was it the best Italian I've had, no, but if you're in the area / want to eat in FIDI, I think it's a great option. \n\nAmbiance / Service: not a huge restaurant, but decent size. There was a large party of probably 10-12 when I was there. The vibe is nice, romantic, but relaxed if that makes sense. You can easily go there to meet up with a friend post work or a date night. Service was good. \n\nFood: I ordered the below and split amongst 2 people and it was a lot of food. \n\n-Polpette (meatballs): comes with 3.                                     "text": {
                                        "full": "I'm not gonna like I really like the food and the vibe here. Perfeft place for a date night. I came here during restaurant week this year but kept forgetting to post the review, lol. I apologize for the tardiness. \n\nTo start off, the cocktails here are pretty good. I got an amber ale, but my homies got some pretty good cocktails. The appetizers were also very good. We all ended up getting the Polpette (meatballs) that beat Bobby Flay. They were pretty flavorful and rich, in my opinion. \n\nFor our mains, we ordered the new York strip, rigatoni con Funghi, and the tagliatelle. All were delicious, but I feel like the rigatoni was very, very rich. It is heavier than the tagliatelle, but the flavor and creaminess are just BOMB. My friend loved her new York strip, and it was cooked perfectly. For desserts, we ordered tiramisu and the polenta cake. We all weren't really big fans of the dessert here, so they could use some improvement. \n\nThe service wasn't the best, to be honest. It's actually the main reason why I didn't give this place 5 stars. It was normal for us not to see our waiter,at a minimum, for over 15 minutes at a time. I hope that gets addressed in the future because I did want to come back and try the pizza, but that service was off-putting.",

                                        "full": "Looking for a spot before a Friday night show at the Flea Theater, we were pleasantly surprised to see a cute place with such solid reviews have availability. \n\nAlso, always on the lookout for sourdough pizza, I emailed them and received a quick response that their pizza was in fact sourdough. \n\nWe arrived right on time with our reservation and were very kindly greeted and shown to our seat. (The employee said that he moved us to a more comfortable option.) He also offered to take our coats, to which I obliged. \n\nThe server was very nice and ran through the specials. They sounded great, but we had mostly decided in advance on the artichoke and the fig and prosciutto pizza. When running through recommendations (at our request), she said the striped bass piccata was a popular dish. We added that. (and a Birra Morretti,) \n\nThe artichokes were divine! The pizza was also fantastic - larger than we expected. The bass was probably a 3.5 stars for us - my wife's first bite had bones in it. I wouldn't say that I loved any bites until my final one. It wasn't bad, just not great. Maybe it could have used a bit more sauce? I wouldn't order it again, but I a) don't order striped bass much and b) am open to ours being a one-off of not-greatness. In other words, I wouldn't discourage someone else from trying it if they are excited. Definitely squeeze the lemon all over it if do. \n\nOverall, 5 stars. It feels like a diamond in the rough in the neighborhood. Great staff, very cozy, and the perfect spot for a date.",
